RESOURCE.DESCRIPTION: Helio HEC time based query V1.16.25
RESOURCE.INFO: SELECT lasco_cme_list.lcl_id,lasco_cme_list.time_start,lasco_cme_list.pa_central,lasco_cme_list.description FROM lasco_cme_list WHERE time_start>='2003-02-01T00:00:00' AND time_start<='2003-02-10T00:00:00' LIMIT 100 OFFSET 0

TR.TD: Bright multiple-loop core with LE visible in C3 images. Possibly connected to Type II burst reported by SEC from 22:09. Some gusty outflow. Already in progress.
Fairly wide bright loop front with multiple- loop core. Possibly connected to earlier event to form ~150 deg partial halo; much gusty outflow between both.
Thin faint well-defined loops move very slowly along wide bright streamer leading to partial blowout. Faster fronts from ~19 UT next day.
Wide bright loop front with cavity and ragged core along streamer.
Slow loop front along streamer, gusty outflow removes substantial part of it.
Ragged front along S edge of streamer, wider brighter loop front with cavity follows at 15:30 then some outflow.
Moderately faint loop front, quite wide and fast, faint corelike region follows.
Ragged front along streamer. some gusty outflow follows.
Moderately wide bright loop front along streamer, cavity and some core-like material follow, then slow narrow loops.
Asymmetric loop front fades somewhat through C2.
Fairly wide bright loop front eventually fills quadrant. Cavity and bright structured core follow. M1.2 X-ray flare AR 0278 N19E57.

Faster brighter front follows previous event. Fast eruptive prominence from/near same active region. Partial streamer blowout results from last two events including very faint fronts spanning into NW. Gusty outflow follows for >24 hrs.
Faint ragged front, follows even fainter front at 17:30.
Asymmetric loop front with slight cavity, quite faint, some gusty outflow including faint fronts.
Bright narrow loop front with slight cavity and some gusty outflow.
